body_content.explanation: the surface of the earth that is not covered by water:
examples: It is cheaper to drill for oil on land than at sea.
The treaty has led to a dramatic reduction in the number of land-based missiles in Europe.
The military commanders won't deploy their land forces until they're satisfied that the air attacks have done their job.

body_content.explanation: an area of ground, especially when used for a particular purpose such as farming or building:
examples: This sort of land is no good for growing potatoes.
I always prosecute people who trespass on my land.
We want to buy a plot of land to build a house.
Most of the families lived off the land (= grew their own food, etc.).
My parents worked (on) the land.
a land of ice and snow
The group want to promote their ideas in schools throughout the land.

body_content.explanation: to (cause to) arrive on the ground or other surface after moving down through the air:
examples: We should land in Madrid at 7 a.m.
You can land a plane on water in an emergency.
The bird landed on my finger.
The report first landed on my desk this morning.

body_content.explanation: to arrive on land from the sea:
examples: We landed at Port Said in the early evening.

body_content.explanation: to arrive at or appear on a particular website:
examples: If you click on the link you land on his blog.
The allegations attracted a lot of attention when they landed on the Drudge Report site in the morning.

body_content.explanation: to take goods or people off a ship or aircraft:
examples: The general's plan involved landing troops behind enemy lines.

body_content.explanation: to catch a fish with a hook (= curved piece of wire) or net and remove it from the water:
examples: He landed a huge salmon.

body_content.explanation: to get or achieve something good, especially in a way that seems easy or unexpected:
examples: He landed a senior editorial job.

body_content.explanation: to happen or succeed as intended:
examples: Some of his jokes didn't really land, but he was pretty funny.

body_content.explanation: If someone lands a blow or it lands, they hit another person:
examples: He managed to land more punches than his opponent.
One blow landed on the right side of his face.

body_content.explanation: in sport, to make a move that is completed successfully:
examples: He landed the jump perfectly.
He landed five goals from eight attempts.
